meanings.definition: A form of punishment or trial in which a person runs between two lines of people who strike at them.
meanings.sent1: During the gantelope, the person had to dodge the strikes from both sides.
meanings.sent2: The gantelope was a harsh punishment in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The gantelope seemed like a challenging game of dodgeball.
meanings.sent4: Facing the gantelope felt like being caught in a storm of blows.
meanings.sent5: The gantelope left a lasting impression on those who witnessed it.

meanings.definition: To subject someone to a gantelope.
meanings.sent1: The commander decided to gantelope the disobedient soldier as a lesson.
meanings.sent2: She feared being ganteloped for her mistake.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to gantelope the students with rulers.
meanings.sent4: The intense training session ganteloped the recruits into shape.
meanings.sent5: He ganteloped the team through a challenging obstacle course.
